trans-unit.source: Create a Java web app in Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a Java web app in Azure App Service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to deploy a Java web app to Azure App Service.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to deploy a Java web app to Azure App Service.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows how to create a web app on Microsoft Azure by using Java, through either the Azure Marketplace or the configuration UI in the <linkText>Web Apps feature in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows how to create a web app on Microsoft Azure by using Java, through either the Azure Marketplace or the configuration UI in the <linkText>Web Apps feature in Azure App Service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you don't want to use either of those techniques—for example, if you want to customize your application container—see <linkText>Upload a custom Java web app to Azure</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't want to use either of those techniques—for example, if you want to customize your application container—see <linkText>Upload a custom Java web app to Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need a Microsoft Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need a Microsoft Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can <linkText>activate your MSDN subscriber benefits</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>sign up for a free trial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can <linkText>activate your MSDN subscriber benefits</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>sign up for a free trial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before you sign up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service—no credit card required, and no commitments.
trans-unit.target: There, you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service—no credit card required, and no commitments.

trans-unit.source: This information shows how to use the Azure Marketplace to select a Java application container, either Apache Tomcat or Jetty, for your web app.
trans-unit.target: This information shows how to use the Azure Marketplace to select a Java application container, either Apache Tomcat or Jetty, for your web app.

trans-unit.source: The following shows how a web app that's built via Tomcat from the Azure Marketplace would appear:
trans-unit.target: The following shows how a web app that's built via Tomcat from the Azure Marketplace would appear:

trans-unit.source: The following shows how a web app that's built via Jetty from the Azure Marketplace would appear:
trans-unit.target: The following shows how a web app that's built via Jetty from the Azure Marketplace would appear:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click New in the bottom left of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click New in the bottom left of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Web + Mobile blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the Web + Mobile blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Azure Marketplace at the bottom of the Web + Mobile blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Azure Marketplace at the bottom of the Web + Mobile blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Web.
trans-unit.target: Click Web.

trans-unit.source: The top of the Web page contains a search text box.
trans-unit.target: The top of the Web page contains a search text box.

trans-unit.source: In this text box, type the desired Java application server, such as Apache Tomcat or Jetty.
trans-unit.target: In this text box, type the desired Java application server, such as Apache Tomcat or Jetty.

trans-unit.source: Click the desired Java application server.
trans-unit.target: Click the desired Java application server.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Specify the URL name.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URL name.

trans-unit.source: Select a region.
trans-unit.target: Select a region.

trans-unit.source: For example, select West US.
trans-unit.target: For example, select West US.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Within a few moments, your web app will be created.
trans-unit.target: Within a few moments, your web app will be created.

trans-unit.source: To view the web app, within the Azure portal, in the Web Apps blade, click the web app, and then click the URL for it.
trans-unit.target: To view the web app, within the Azure portal, in the Web Apps blade, click the web app, and then click the URL for it.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've created the web app with an app container, see the Next steps section for information about uploading your application to the web app.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've created the web app with an app container, see the Next steps section for information about uploading your application to the web app.

trans-unit.source: This information shows how to use the Azure configuration UI to select a Java application container, either Apache Tomcat or Jetty, for your web app.
trans-unit.target: This information shows how to use the Azure configuration UI to select a Java application container, either Apache Tomcat or Jetty, for your web app.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Click New in the bottom left of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click New in the bottom left of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click the Web + Mobile blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the Web + Mobile blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Azure Marketplace at the bottom of the Web + Mobile blade.
trans-unit.target: Click Azure Marketplace at the bottom of the Web + Mobile blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Web.
trans-unit.target: Click Web.

trans-unit.source: Click Web App.
trans-unit.target: Click Web App.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: Specify the URL name.
trans-unit.target: Specify the URL name.

trans-unit.source: Select a region.
trans-unit.target: Select a region.

trans-unit.source: For example, select West US.
trans-unit.target: For example, select West US.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: When the web app has been created, click All settings.
trans-unit.target: When the web app has been created, click All settings.

trans-unit.source: Click Application settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Application settings.

trans-unit.source: Click the desired Java version.
trans-unit.target: Click the desired Java version.

trans-unit.source: The options for the web container are displayed, for example, Tomcat and Jetty.
trans-unit.target: The options for the web container are displayed, for example, Tomcat and Jetty.

trans-unit.source: Select the desired Web container.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired Web container.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Within a few moments, your web app will become Java-based.
trans-unit.target: Within a few moments, your web app will become Java-based.

trans-unit.source: To confirm that it is Java-based, click its URL.
trans-unit.target: To confirm that it is Java-based, click its URL.

trans-unit.source: Note that the page will provide text stating that the new web app is a Java-based web app.
trans-unit.target: Note that the page will provide text stating that the new web app is a Java-based web app.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've created the web app with an app container, see the Next steps section for information about uploading your application to the web app.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've created the web app with an app container, see the Next steps section for information about uploading your application to the web app.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you have a Java application server running as your Java web app on Azure.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you have a Java application server running as your Java web app on Azure.

trans-unit.source: To add in your own application or webpage, see <linkText>Add an application or webpage to your Java web app</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To add in your own application or webpage, see <linkText>Add an application or webpage to your Java web app</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service, see <linkText>Azure App Service and existing Azure services</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service, see <linkText>Azure App Service and existing Azure services</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from the old portal to the new portal, see <linkText>Reference for navigating the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from the old portal to the new portal, see <linkText>Reference for navigating the Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
